page.title: 08HAMLETS NORTH OF PULBOROUGH
page.content: Apart from a few large houses, farmhouses and farmworkers cottages,there are two small hamlets in this area, Codmore Hill and North Heath. Codmore Hill is a suburb of Pulborough with ribbon developement of family houses along the A29 and on country roads east and west of the Rose and Crown public house. This community was also served by a grocers shop and dairy. The dairy has been built over; and, after selling antiques, the shop is now empty. Gay Street Lane is the main residential road in North Heath. Homes on the lane are a mixture of pre 1939 timber bungalows and modern houses. Children from both hamlets used to attend a primary school on the A29 but the school has now been converted to a dwelling-house.
